page.title: 09RUNKERRY HOUSE (BUSHMILLS)
page.content: Runkerry House was built in 1883 at the eastern end of Blackrock Strand, Portballintrae. The daughters of Lord McNaghten lived there until it was no longer required by them. It was then used as an{Old People'S home. This building is now used as an {Outdoor Pursuits Centre. }Here young people take part in canoeing,climbing and sailing. They usually stay for a period of ten days. The number of staff at Runkerry Outdoor Persuits Centre is fifteen and it has been in operation for nine and a half years.
